item.title: Fallout 76 Player Creates Incredible Vault Boy Art in Their Camp
item.description:
A talented Fallout 76 player online has shared their epic Vault Boy art installation that they have created at their in-game camp. This Fallout 76 creation shows what the most talented creators can do with the game's camp-building tools.

In Fallout 76 , camps are portable homes that players can set up around the wasteland. This is in contrast to Fallout 4 's settlements, which allowed players to build in set areas defined by Bethesda. Regardless, the communities of both titles have been massively creative in building unique camps and settlements since their release. For example, one Fallout 76 player even turned an old rail car into an incredible camp, showing how various parts of the world can be transformed with this system.

X user JamesTwoSheep shared their interesting creation at their Fallout 76 camp, which initially looks like a bunch of floating junk. However, as they ascend a staircase and get the proper perspective, the junk transforms into the image of a frowning Vault Boy, which must have taken a ton of effort to get right. It doesn't end there, though. JamesTwoSheep then heads to another staircase on the opposite side of the room, revealing the face of a smiling Vault boy instead.

Fallout 76 Player Makes Vault Boy Perspective Art Out of Junk

Unfortunately, JamesTwoSheep didn't reveal how long the creation took them to complete, although considering all the Fallout 76 junk involved, it can't have been a quick process, especially given its double-sided nature. The responses to the creation were universally positive, with one user even describing it as a "mixture of Silent Hill and Fallout ."

While fans continue to create more impressive things using the tools currently available, Fallout 76 itself continues to go from strength to strength. Earlier this year, Bethesda rolled out an update that gave players the ability to play as a ghoul, while another recent content drop kicked off the game's Season 21 with a fun fishing theme. There are more exciting plans to come for Fallout 76 , with an update in the works dedicated to the game's camp-building community.

item.title: All Packs in The Sims 4 Summer Sale (2025)
item.description:
The Sims 4 has dozens of packs, ranging from major yet costly expansion packs to CAS or Build Mode-focused $5 kits. While the base game may be enough for some players, those who want to expand and complement their gaming experience with additional worlds, skills, gameplay elements, and cosmetic items can do so by choosing packs that appeal to their preferences.

Ultimately, there is something for everybody when it comes to Sims 4 packs. The Summer Sale is one of the most anticipated sales in The Sims 4 , and it's here at last. This article breaks down the most important information so fans can start planning what they'd like to add to their Sims 4 library this summer.

All Packs Featured in The Sims 4 Summer Sale

Most packs can be purchased at a discount during the Summer Sale, even the most recently released expansion pack, Businesses and Hobbies. The only packs not featured in the Summer Sale are the newly released kits and the upcoming expansion pack.

Packs not included during the Summer Sale:

  • Enchanted by Nature expansion pack
  • Golden Years kit
  • Kitchen Clutter kit
  • Restoration Workshop kit
  • Sleek Bathroom kit
  • Sweet Allure kit

Here are all of the packs in The Sims 4 Summer Sale:

Expansion Packs

Players can get the best deals when shopping for Sims 4 expansion packs during this sale, as they can purchase them for less than half their original price.

Is The Sims 4 Summer Sale Available on All Platforms?

There are Summer Sales that feature The Sims 4 on platforms such as Xbox, PlayStation, and Steam. However, the full-blown sale that lasts the longest and features the most games is exclusive to the EA App. Unfortunately, at the moment, Sims 4 packs are not on sale on the Epic Games Store.

When Does The Sims 4 Summer Sale End?

The Sims 4 Summer Sale End Date

Steam players can enjoy the EA Summer Sale until June 26. On Xbox, Sims 4 packs will be available at a discount price until June 23, but PlayStation players have a bit longer since it's live until July 2. As for fans using the EA App, they have a fair amount of time to enjoy The Sims 4 Summer Sale, as it'll be live until July 10, 2025.

item.title: The Alters: Can You Save Molly?
item.description:
The survival and social game called The Alters has some pretty dark undertones, and it doesn't take long for the dangers of the mission to catch up with everyone on board. This includes Molly the sheep, the beloved mascot of your journey so far.

At the beginning of Act 2 of The Alters , you will start to notice things going downhill for poor Molly, and you might be wondering if there is anything you can do to help the poor critter to keep her from meeting her fate.

Can Molly the Sheep Be Saved in Act 2 of The Alters?

The short answer to this is no . Molly is the catalyst for the crew to realize there is something wrong and kick starts the most challenging choice of the plot: whether to side with Lena and get the brain implants or choose the Tabula Rasa and Maxwell. Her death is imperative to the plot, and even Jan Scientist and Jan Doctor can't help her out, even if you have them both when you head to play.

Can You Pet the Sheep in The Alters?

Before Molly passes away, you can give her a pat . Just head into The Womb where she hangs out and use the interact button to give her a nice scratch on her head. In fact, this is an achievement in The Alters , so it's a good idea to do this before you lose her on the second or third day of Act 2.

Where Does Molly End Up After She Dies in The Alters?

You can visit Molly's grave after her autopsy is completed. The alters all gathered together to give their sheep friend as good a sendoff as they could, burying her near the ship and even carving her a little headstone. You can tell that having the animal on board boosted the alters' happiness.

Here is a map of where to find this location after the research on her body is complete:

Can You Make Another Sheep in The Alters?

Despite the fact that you made Molly in the first place and have been churning out alters of yourself, it doesn't appear that you have the ability to make a new sheep to replace her after she passes away. Perhaps this is because you used up the sheep DNA in the first round of creation, or maybe it's because the developers didn't think of it. As such, you and your growing crew of alters will need to continue on your journey without the fluffy friend you've all come to rely on.

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: MLB The Show 25: All Conquest Hidden Reward Locations
item.description:
MLB The Show 25 gives you many different ways to earn free packs in Diamond Dynasty, but none are quite as easy as finding Conquest hidden rewards. Without playing a single game, you can net multiple packs that may hold valuable new pieces of your Diamond Dynasty lineup.

As you continue to reinforce your Diamond Dynasty collection throughout the year, each new Conquest map is sure to hold some valuable hidden rewards. Here's exactly where you need to look to find all Conquest hidden rewards in MLB The Show 25 .

All MLB The Show 25 Conquest Hidden Reward Locations

If you want free packs without even having to play a full game , Conquest is the place to be in MLB The Show 25 . This unique tile-based game mode lets you build up reinforcements and simulate games tile by tile as you conquer every possible territory on a map. If your squad needs some pitching help or backup at any position, scoring hidden rewards could fill that gap before you have to hit the field again in Diamond Dynasty.

To finish a Conquest map, you'll also need to play and win at least one three-inning game at each Stronghold . With a little patience, you can usually build up reinforcements to play almost every Stronghold game on Rookie or Veteran difficulty and start building your roster in Diamond Dynasty.

Conquest maps occasionally include turn-based goals where you'll need to capture a Stronghold by a certain turn, but every completed goal will also net you Diamond Dynasty rewards in MLB The Show 25 . You won't want to miss out on freebies like Bat Skins, Stadium Packs, Headliners Packs, Stubs, XP, and more .

Sunny Map Hidden Reward Locations

The numbers above correspond to the following Conquest hidden rewards:

  1. The Show Pack
  2. The Show Pack
  3. Headliners Pack
  4. The Show Pack
  5. City Connect Pack
  6. The JUMBO Show Pack
  7. The Show Pack
  8. Headliners Pack
  9. The Show Pack

Finishing the Sunny Conquest Map will also earn you one more The Show Pack, two more Headliners Packs, one Ballin' is a Habit Pack, one Summer Deluxe Pack, and 4500 XP .

The numbers above correspond to the following Conquest hidden rewards:

Every new pack is a chance for a valuable addition to your Diamond Dynasty lineup, and Conquest hidden rewards remain one of the best ways to get them in MLB The Show 25 .

item.title: Shenhe Team Composition Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Shenhe

Cryo

Polearm

Liyue

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Shenhe's teams will mainly consist of Cryo units, as she mainly operates as a Cryo Support in Genshin Impact . When creating a team for Shenhe, players have to be aware of who will benefit from her Elemental Skill and who won't. Here are some examples of the best Shenhe teams in Genshin Impact .

3 Shenhe + Skirk + Furina + Escoffier

This Shenhe team depends on Skirk dealing DMG with her Normal attacks and Elemental Burst. Players can set the field ready for Skirk and choose to quickly let out her Burst DMG or use her Elemental Skill and start dealing Normal Attack DMG to enemies.

The idea behind having only Hydro and Cryo characters in the team is to activate Skirks Ascension passive that grants her over 150% extra DMG on her Elemental Burst and Normal Attack DMG. Of course, Furina and Shenhe further increase Skirks Cryo DMG, while Shenhe also participates with Escoffier to massively reduce enemies resistance to Cryo DMG. This is not just a perfect team for Shenhe, its also one of the best teams in Genshin Impact .

Team Roles

  • Shenhe: Buffer, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler
  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, Healer, Buffer, Hydro Enabler
  • Escoffier: Sub-DPS, Healer, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler

2 Shenhe + Wriothesley + Emilie + Thoma

This Burning team in Genshin Impact works to keep enemies affected by Pyro, while Wriothesley is just enjoying an endless amount of Reverse Melt reactions. Players can swap Wriothesley with Ganyu , Ayaka , or even Skirk . Nahida can replace Emilie, and Xiangling can take Thomas place.

Having a Dendro unit like Emilie ensures that off-field Dendro applications are always present, while Thoma coordinates with Wriothesley to keep applying Pyro. Both Emilie and Thoma will continuously trigger the Burning reaction, which will keep applying the Pyro element on enemies, even after Wriothesley consumes it to trigger Melt. This is where Shenhe comes into play. She will amplify Wriothesleys DMG, which will greatly increase his Melt reactions.

Team Roles

  • Shenhe: Buffer, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler
  • Wriothesley: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Emilie: Sub-DPS, Dendro Enabler
  • Thoma: Shielder, Pyro Enabler

1 Shenhe + Chasca + Furina + Bennett

Chasca takes the Elements of every character in her team and shoots them out during her Elemental Skill state. She sends a couple of extra Anemo shots just to Swirl these Elements together, which creates an interesting mechanic for her teams. Having buffers join this will not only allow Chasca to shoot their Elements, but they will also amplify them to deal more DMG.

The combo of Shenhe, Furina, and Bennett adds Cryo, Hydro, and Pyro attacks to Chasca, which will trigger the Frozen, Melt, and Vaporize reactions when she shoots. Now, imagine all these attacks and reactions amplified by Furina, Bennett, and Shenhe.

Team Roles

  • Shenhe: Buffer, Debuffer, Cryo Enabler
  • Chasca: Main DPS, Driver
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, Healer, Buffer, Hydro Enabler
  • Bennett: Healer, Pyro Enabler
